briefdescription.para: Get modifier string calculated from JPCRE2 and PCRE2 options.

detaileddescription.para: Calculate modifier string from compile_opts and jpcre2_compile_opts and return it.

Note that, this only gives you the modifiers used for pattern compilation. There is no such function to get the action modifiers and neither there's any need for it as action modifiers are required to be passed anew with every action. On the other hand, you may set some modifiers to the Regex object and forget about it later or you may want to get the existing modifier and compile the regex again by modifying the existing ones.
Do remember that modifiers (or PCRE2 and JPCRE2 options) do not change or get initialized as long as you don't do that explicitly. Calling Regex::setModifier() will re-set them.
Mixed or combined modifier.

Some modifier may include other modifiers i.e they have the same meaning of some modifiers combined together. For example, the 'n' modifier includes the 'u' modifier and together they are equivalent to PCRE2_UTF | PCRE2_UCP. When you set a modifier like this, both options get set, and when you remove (Regex::changeModifier()) the 'n', both will get removed
Calculated modifier string

briefdescription.para: Set the Pattern string pat_str.
Set the modifier (overwrite existing JPCRE2 and PCRE2 option).

detaileddescription.para: Re-initializes the option bits for PCRE2 and JPCRE2 options, then parses the modifier and sets equivalent PCRE2 and JPCRE2 options.

Note: If speed of operation is very crucial, use Regex::setJpcre2Option() and Regex::setPcre2Option() with equivalent options. It will be faster that way.
jpcre2::Except
Throws exception with ERROR::INVALID_MODIFIER as error number if jpcre2::VALIDATE_MODIFIER or jpcre2::ERROR_ALL is set and a wrong modifier was encountered.
x
Modifier string
Regex&

RegexReplace::setModifier()

Set PCRE2 option compile_opts (overwrites existing option)
Parse modifier and add/remove equivalent PCRE2 and JPCRE2 options.

detaileddescription.para: After a call to this function compile_opts and jpcre2_compile_opts will be properly set.
This function does not initialize or re-initialize options. If you want to set options from scratch, initialize them to 0 before calling this function.

Note: If speed of operation is very crucial, use Regex::changeJpcre2Option() and Regex::changePcre2Option() with equivalent options. It will be faster that way.
jpcre2::Except
Throws exception with ERROR::INVALID_MODIFIER if jpcre2::VALIDATE_MODIFIER or jpcre2::ERROR_ALL was set and a wrong modifier was encountered.
mod
Modifier string
x
Whether to add or remove option

briefdescription.para: Add or remove a PCRE2 option.

parameterdescription.para: Add the option if it's true, remove otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Parse modifier string and add equivalent PCRE2 and JPCRE2 options.

detaileddescription.para: This is just a wrapper of the original function Regex::changeModifier() provided for convenience.

Note: If speed of operation is very crucial, use Regex::addJpcre2Option() and Regex::addPcre2Option() with equivalent options. It will be faster that way.

briefdescription.para: Implements public overloaded and copy constructors, provides functions to set/unset various options and perform regex match and replace against a compiled pattern.

detaileddescription.para: Each regex pattern needs an object of this class.
A pattern must be compiled either by explicitly calling the compile function or using one of the parameterized constructors.
